author: KarolKaczmarek
body:
- Detecting mc.exe in the right folder.
- Improving error message
- Adding installation of choco, cmake and Win 10 SDK to Start-PSBootstrap

comments.author: vors
comments.body:
There are multiply places, where mc.exe can be located. The old one works on some machines (CI and my dev machine). Maybe do some re-try logic for both places?

Also, excellent point about choco.
I think we should add following logic in `Start-PSBootstrap`
1. If choco is installed and we detected missed components bring them thru choco.
2. If not, error out with instruction about manual install

comments.author: KarolKaczmarek
comments.body:
@vors @mirichmo I've updated the Start-PSBootstrap to automate installation of choco, cmake and Win 10 SDK. 

@vors Regarding what mc.exe location we should use, I believe Win10 SDK always installs it under "Windows Kits". The older versions of SDK used to install it under "Microsoft SDKs", however the compiler got updated since then so we should rely on the latest bits. As I mentioned, I added Win10 SDK installation to the bootstrapping function, so we should always have it available where we expect it now.

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body:
A couple issues:
- We should not install choco if the prereqs are all there.  The check right now installs choco if you don't have it.
- We shouldn't change the machine path without prompting.

And before this gets merged, let's clean up the commits - there are nearly as many commits as lines changed.

comments.author: vors
comments.body:
@KarolKaczmarek I see about mc.exe, good point. Thank you for doing that!
Please add a prompt for choco installation. We should not do this without users approval or `-Force`.
